metadata.title: CVE-2018-0737 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The OpenSSL RSA Key generation algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable toa cache timing side channel attack. An attacker with sufficient access tomount cache timing attacks during the RSA key generation process couldrecover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0i-dev (Affected1.1.0-1.1.0h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2p-dev (Affected 1.0.2b-1.0.2o).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13').
